sentences.en: " Becky " -- pleadingly. " Becky, won't you say something? "
sentences.cn: “ 贝基, ” —— 汤姆恳求道, “ 贝基, 你说话好不好? ”

sentences.en: " Becky, can you bear it if I tell you something? "
sentences.cn: “ 贝基,如果我告诉你, 你受得了 吗 ? ”

sentences.en: " Becky, I -- I don't care for anybody but you. "
sentences.cn: “ 贝基, 我不喜欢别人,只喜欢你. ”

sentences.en: " Becky, I was such a fool!
" I acted mighty mean to - day, Becky, and I'm so sorry.
sentences.cn: “ 贝基, 我很抱歉,今天那样做实在对不起人.
“ 好了, 贝基,该做的都做了.

sentences.en: " Now, Becky, it's all done -- all over but the kiss.
sentences.cn: “ 好了, 贝基, 现在一切都做了 —— 就差接吻了.

sentences.en: " Oh , don't do it again, Tom, it is too horrid,'said Becky.
sentences.cn: “ 喂, 汤姆,别喊了, 听起来怪吓人的. ” 贝基说.

sentences.en: " Oh, don't cry, Becky, I don't care for her any more. "
sentences.cn: “ 哦, 贝基, 不要哭, 我已经不再喜欢她了. ”

sentences.en: " Please, Becky, won't you take it? "
sentences.cn: “ 求求你了, 贝基, 拿着这个好 不好 ? ”

sentences.en: Becky could still recall that first meeting clearly.
sentences.cn: 贝姬还能清晰地记起初次见面的情景.

sentences.en: Becky was not to have gone home that night!
sentences.cn: 贝基说好那天晚上不回家.

sentences.en: Becky's face paled, but she thought she could.
sentences.cn: 贝基的脸色发白, 可她觉得她能受得了.

sentences.en: By - and - by Becky suggested that they move on again.
sentences.cn: 这时贝基又开始建议继续往前走.

sentences.en: John and Becky were then in their late twenties and had no need of our permission, but we encouraged them to give it a try.
sentences.cn: 当时约翰和贝基已经是二十八九，做这个决定并没有必要得到我们的批准，但我们还是鼓励他们去试试。

sentences.en: Please, Becky -- I'll whisper it, I'll whisper it ever so easy. "
sentences.cn: 求求你, 贝基 —— 我小声说, 我轻轻地说. ”

sentences.en: So John and Becky and their two little girls go on with their semi-rural life in Alaska.
sentences.cn: 约翰和贝基以及他们的两个小女儿继续着在阿拉斯加的半乡村式的生活。
